info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 2:11PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Mineral County through 245 PM MDT... At 210 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near St. Regis, or 17 miles west of Superior. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Locations impacted include... De Borgia and St. Regis. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 20 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
